intro: Christella latipinna, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. Christella latipinna is adapted to drought conditions and has a deep root system to access water.
